data.question: What is the chemical formula for α-uranyl phenylphosphonate?
What is the space group of β-uranyl phenylphosphonate?
What is the coordination of uranium atoms in both α-UPP and β-UPP?
What triggers the transformation of α-UPP into β-UPP?
True or False: The luminescence of β-UPP is due to electron transfer.
What is the main difference in the arrangement of phenyl rings between α-UPP and β-UPP?
data.answer: α-UPP arranges in cis conformation, whereas β-UPP arranges in trans conformation.

data.question: True or False: The transformation from α-UPP to β-UPP can occur without bond breaking and bond making.
What is the role of humidity in the transformation of α-UPP into β-UPP?
data.answer: High humidity speeds up the transformation process.

data.question: True or False: α-UPP exhibits intense emission at room temperature.
What is the likely cause of the different luminescence behavior between α-UPP and β-UPP?
data.answer: Lattice vibrations and thermal motion of the linear chains.

data.question: True or False: The transformation of α-UPP into β-UPP is reversible.
What happens to α-UPP when exposed to dry nitrogen gas?
data.answer: It collapses and loses up to 6 of the 8 uncoordinated lattice water molecules.

data.question: True or False: β-UPP is thermodynamically more stable than α-UPP.
What is the effect of cooling α-UPP to liquid nitrogen temperature?
True or False: The transformation from α-UPP to β-UPP significantly changes the chemical environment around the uranyl ion.
What is the publication year of the article discussing the transformation of α-UPP into β-UPP?
True or False: The transformation of α-UPP into β-UPP can be accelerated by dehydration and rehydration.
What is the mechanism suggested for the cis-to-trans transformation in the phase change?
data.answer: Breaking a U−Oequatorial bond, followed by rotation of a phenylphosphonate group.

data.question: True or False: The adjacent metal atoms in α-UPP and β-UPP are bridged by pairs of phenylphosphonate groups.
What is the role of lattice water molecules in the transformation mechanism?
data.answer: They serve as proton carriers facilitating the deprotonation and protonation during the transformation.
